node.title: feat: improve footer
node.body: This PR aims at improving the footer of the website (navigation, logo, background of light theme). It is related to the issue #353 Still to be done : center the column -> help needed. ## Summary by CodeRabbit - **Documentation** - Updated the footer section with new links and sections for improved navigation and resource accessibility. - **Style** - Enhanced the footer's visual appeal with a new gradient background. - Improved the layout of the footer for better alignment and readability using flexbox properties.

nodes.bodyText:
Walkthrough
The changes involve a refresh of the website's footer design and content. New logos and links have been added to the footer configuration, enhancing the navigation and branding. Additionally, the footer's visual style has been updated with new gradient colors, and its layout has been restructured to be more centered and columnar, improving the overall aesthetic and user experience.
Changes



File Path
Change Summary




docusaurus.config.js
Added logos, Docs, and Community links, and a new Tools section to the footer configuration.


src/scss/custom.scss
Modified gradient direction and color for the footer background.


src/scss/main.scss
Applied flexbox layout properties to the .footer class for better alignment and positioning.




🐇✨
A footer refreshed, a website anew,
Links and logos join the crew.
In colors that blend like morning dew,
A rabbit's touch, in every hue. 🌈🐾
















Thank you for using CodeRabbit. We offer it for free to the OSS community and would appreciate your support in helping us grow. If you find it useful, would you consider giving us a shout-out on your favorite social media?

Share

X
Mastodon
Reddit
LinkedIn





Tips
Chat with CodeRabbit Bot (@coderabbitai)

You can directly reply to a review comment made by CodeRabbit. Example:

I pushed a fix in commit <commit_id>.
Generate unit-tests for this file.


You can tag CodeRabbit on specific lines of code or entire files in the PR by tagging @coderabbitai in a comment. Examples:

@coderabbitai generate unit tests for this file.
@coderabbitai modularize this function.


You can tag @coderabbitai in a PR comment and ask questions about the PR and the codebase. Examples:

@coderabbitai generate interesting stats about this repository from git and render them as a table.
@coderabbitai show all the console.log statements in this repository.
@coderabbitai read src/utils.ts and generate unit tests.
@coderabbitai read the files in the  src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid.
@coderabbitai read the files in the  src/scheduler package and generate README in the markdown format.



Note: Be mindful of the bot's finite context window. It's strongly recommended to break down tasks such as reading entire modules into smaller chunks.
CodeRabbit Commands (invoked as PR comments)

@coderabbitai pause to pause the reviews on a PR.
@coderabbitai resume to resume the paused reviews.
@coderabbitai review to trigger a review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository.
@coderabbitai resolve resolve all the CodeRabbit review comments.
@coderabbitai help to get help.

Additionally, you can add @coderabbitai ignore anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
CodeRabbit Configration File (.coderabbit.yaml)

You can programmatically configure CodeRabbit by adding a .coderabbit.yaml file to the root of your repository.
The JSON schema for the configuration file is available here.
If your editor has YAML language server enabled, you can add the path at the top of this file to enable auto-completion and validation: # yaml-language-server: $schema=https://coderabbit.ai/integrations/coderabbit-overrides.v2.json

CodeRabbit Discord Community
Join our Discord Community to get help, request features, and share feedback.

@MdechampG The footer is already centred. It's not quite what you think, but you'll understand the layout of the blocks better with the following screenshot:

It can be adjusted to give a better impression of centring, particularly on wide devices. You tell me.

@MdechampG The footer is already centred. It's not quite what you think, but you'll understand the layout of the blocks better with the following screenshot:

It can be adjusted to give a better impression of centring, particularly on wide devices. You tell me.

Thank you I understand better. I have added a fourth column it is a less disturbing for me.
It's okay for me like that. Do you agree @JulienMassonnat ?

Thank you I understand better. I have added a fourth column it is a less disturbing for me. It's okay for me like that. Do you agree @JulienMassonnat ?

It's ok for me. It's look better.
Just that for mobile devices, only 3 columns are displayed per line, which sends the 4th column to a new line. cf screenshot.

Ok for me for Desktop it's nice.
On smartphone usually we put only 1 or 2 columns.
You can see a lot of examples here : https://www.footer.design
@MdechampG i've rebased some commits to please the linter.

Ok for me for Desktop it's nice. On smartphone usually we put only 1 or 2 columns. You can see a lot of examples here : https://www.footer.design

I try to do it.
I managed to create 2 columns instead of 4 for small screens but the content displays only in the first column. I don't find the solution, do you have an idea @JulienMassonnat @ccamel  ?
@MdechampG gonna take a look to make progress on this one.

@MdechampG @JulienMassonnat, by f1cb4dd I've improved the responsiveness of the footer, as such:

Based on the output, two URLs did not pass the check. It is recommended to verify these URLs manually to ensure they are correct and accessible.

Analysis chain

Note: This review was outside the patches, so it was mapped to the patch with the greatest overlap. Original lines [156-240]

Please verify that all new URLs are valid and lead to the intended destinations. This is to ensure that the footer links are functional and do not lead to broken pages.


Scripts Executed
The following scripts were executed for the analysis:

Script:
#!/bin/bash
# Verify the URLs added to the footer. Expecting HTTP status 200 for all.
urls=(
  'https://okp4.network'
  'https://chat.openai.com/g/g-zUzcYmVbX-okp4-druid-oracle-beta'
  'https://t.me/okp4network'
  'https://zealy.io/c/okp4/questboard'
  'https://explore.okp4.network/OKP4%20testnet'
  'https://faucet.okp4.network'
)

for url in "${urls[@]}"; do
  if ! curl --output /dev/null --silent --head --fail "$url"; then
    echo "URL check failed for $url"
  else
    echo "URL check passed for $url"
  fi
done

Length of output: 1632

Thanks for reporting. It's under control:

https://chat.openai.com/g/g-zUzcYmVbX-okp4-druid-oracle-beta is accessible
https://faucet.okp4.network is indeed down, but we're dealing with it.

node.title: 整理: 疑問形 upspeak の単純化
node.body:
## 内容
概要: 疑問形 upspeak 処理の単純化によるリファクタリング  

ネストの解消・処理の簡素化によってリファクタリングをおこなった。  

## 関連 Issue
part of #897

## Reviewer 向け情報
3つの関数ネストを削除したため、diff が機能していません。  
commit ごとに 1 つの関数を削除したため、レビュー時には commit log を参照していただければ幸いです。

node.bodyText:
この変更ですが、一般的には関数側にフラグを与えてどうするかを委ねるよりも、単一処理を行う関数にするのが良いとされていると思います。
ChatGPTに両者のメリットを聞いてみた感じ、この返答が自分の考えと近かったです。
https://chat.openai.com/share/cb0a7a43-fbff-4876-801a-921c90ed5618
何かこうしている意図があれば知りたいです！

一般的には ... 単一処理を行う関数にするのが良い

👍
一般論として同意です。

こうしている意図があれば

「upspeak 適用有無含めて 1 機能とみなし、厳密にテストできるから」が意図/理由です。
現在の test_synthesis_engine_base.py では spy に用いて .synthesis() の一部をテストしています。

  
    
      voicevox_engine/test/test_synthesis_engine_base.py
    
    
        Lines 214 to 218
      in
      831d28a
    
  
  
    

        
          
           self.synthesis_engine.synthesis( 
        

        
          
               query, 0, enable_interrogative_upspeak=enable_interrogative_upspeak 
        

        
          
           ) 
        

        
          
           # _synthesis_implの第一引数に与えられたqueryを検証 
        

        
          
           actual = self.synthesis_engine._synthesis_impl.call_args[0][0].accent_phrases 
        
    
  



  
    
      voicevox_engine/test/test_synthesis_engine_base.py
    
    
        Lines 255 to 259
      in
      831d28a
    
  
  
    

        
          
           self.create_synthesis_test_base( 
        

        
          
               text="これはありますか？", 
        

        
          
               expected=expected, 
        

        
          
               enable_interrogative_upspeak=False, 
        

        
          
           ) 
        
    
  


このテスト対象領域が「upspeak 適用有無 + upspeak適用」つまり今回切り出された apply_interrogative_upspeak() に相当するコードです。
現在のテストではこのコードを enable_interrogative_upspeak フラグ値を変えながら幅広いパターンでテストしています。この幅広さはupspeak有無のバグが品質に大きな影響を与えるためだと思われます。
#899 で議論されたように .synthesis() の入力設定全パターンテストは不可能です。
これが理由で、フラグを外に出すと現行の「enable_interrogative_upspeak フラグ値を変えながら幅広いパターン」を捨てることになります。
enable_interrogative_upspeak フラグを upspeak 量を調整する何かと見做してしまえば、apply_interrogative_upspeak() の引数に調整設定値が入るのはそこまで違和感無いと思います。
よって upspeak適用有無含めて 1 機能とみなすのは（少なくとも）おかしなことではなく、他のメリット・デメリットでフラグを引数にするか否か決めて良いことになります。
これら観点を総合した結果、適用有無含め1機能と見做して現行の幅広いテストを保持することが最善と考え、一般論とは異なる切り出し方をしています。
追記:
将来の方向性として、

#897 が進行して .synthesis() と ._synthesis_impl() が統合
query_to_decoder_feature() 内へ本 PR の apply_interrogative_upspeak() を移植
他の apply 関数達と並ぶ

を想定しています（下コードは最終状態のイメージ）
def query_to_decoder_feature(query) -> tuple[ndarray, ndarray]:
    accent_phrases = query.accent_phrases
    # 設定を適用する
    accent_phrases = apply_interrogative_upspeak(accent_phrases, query) # query内upspeakフラグ
    moras = apply_prepost_silence(to_flatten_moras(accent_phrases), query)
    moras = apply_speed_scale(moras, query)
    moras = apply_pitch_scale(moras, query)
    ...

なるほどです！！
少なくとも今のPRのapply_interrogative_upspeak関数は、queryクラス（つまり関数の責務範囲外）にenable_interrogative_upspeakがあることを想定しないべきだと思います。この関数だけ見た場合に、なぜこのフラグがあるのかわからないかなと。
queryそのものを渡す設計を予定しているのであれば話は別でした。いったんNOTEコメントが有ると良いのかなと！
コメントを追加してマージさせていただこうと思います！

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                """必要に応じて各アクセント句の末尾へ疑問形モーラ（同一母音・継続長 0.15秒・音高↑）を付与する"""
          
          
            
                """必要に応じて各アクセント句の末尾へ疑問形モーラ（同一母音・継続長 0.15秒・音高↑）を付与する"""
          
          
            
                # NOTE: 将来的にAudioQueryインスタンスを引数にする予定
LGTM！！！

node.title: [Configs] Add foundation for RelayMiner operation configs.
node.body:
## Summary

### Human Summary

* Implement new `RlayMiner` configuration (#246) parser
* Adapt `RelayMiner` server initialization to
  * Source from the config
  * Check if the config matches the on-chain `Supplier`'s data
  * Support multiple proxy server instances 
* Adapt the `RelayMiner` config parser tests
* Adapt the `RelayMiner` unit tests

This PR is based on #257 and deprecates the `RelayMiner` part of it.

## Issue

- #274
- #271

## Type of change

Select one or more:

- [x] New feature, functionality or library
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ ] Code health or cleanup
- [ ] Documentation
- [ ] Other (specify)

## Testing

- [x] **Run all unit tests**: `make go_develop_and_test`
- [ ] **Run E2E tests locally**: `make test_e2e`
- [ ] **Run E2E tests on DevNet**: Add the `devnet-test-e2e` label to the PR. This is VERY expensive, only do it after all the reviews are complete.

## Sanity Checklist

- [x] I have tested my changes using the available tooling
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, updated documentation and left TODOs throughout the codebase

nodes.bodyText: The CI will now also run the e2e tests on devnet, which increases the time it takes to complete all CI checks.

@okdas  may provide more arguments.
The main reasons I see are

The service staked for may contain multiple endpoints (eg. to handle geolocated requests) and we must handle this scenario.
That the operator may want to route the requests coming from these domains to a single proxy
Migrating to a new domain, where requests may still arrive from the old one
Having internal requests coming from non FQDNs because of complex routing and debugging purposes.
Moved to the right section but will let @okdas explain how this is useful. I will then update the comment accordingly.

@red-0ne is correct. If we can support multiple, I'd say this is the way. It allows for easier migrations across domains, it gives more flexibility.
